meanings.definition: To cut or gather (a crop) for harvest.
meanings.sent1: The farmer reaps the ripe wheat from the field.
meanings.sent2: Every autumn, the farmer reaps the fruits of his labor.
meanings.sent3: The scarecrow tried to reap the corn, but its arms were too short!
meanings.sent4: She sowed kindness and reaped a bountiful harvest of friendship.
meanings.sent5: The sun reaps the golden fields at the end of each day.

meanings.definition: To receive as a consequence of one's own or others' actions.
meanings.sent1: He reaps the rewards of his hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent2: If you plant seeds of kindness, you will reap happiness in return.
meanings.sent3: The lazy squirrel expected to reap the benefits without any effort.
meanings.sent4: She reaped the consequences of her reckless behavior.
meanings.sent5: Actions have consequences, and we all reap what we sow.

meanings.sent1: She reaps knowledge from books and experiences.
meanings.sent2: Hard work and perseverance help you reap success in life.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox always finds a way to reap the rewards.
meanings.sent4: He reaped the benefits of his strategic planning.
meanings.sent5: In life, you reap what you invest your time and energy in.
